conclusion: To determine when the two objects are farthest apart, we need to analyze the velocity-time graphs of Object A and Object B.
The red line represents the velocity of Object A, and the blue line represents the velocity of Object B.
At time t1, Object A is moving at a velocity of v0.
At time t2, Object A has slowed down to a velocity of v0.
At time t3, Object A has stopped moving.
At time t4, Object B has started moving at a velocity of v0.
The distance between the two objects can be calculated using the formula: Distance = ∫(vB - vA) dt.
Substituting the given values: Distance = ∫(v0 - v0) dt = 0.
This indicates that the distance between the two objects is zero at all times.
The distance between the two objects is zero at all times, which means they are always at the same distance from each other.
The two objects are farthest apart at all times.
